text: Every time he began to think of all these details was by no means out of the wood.

passages.fragment: Every time he began to think
passages.full_quote: <used>Every time he began to think</used> about it, he felt that he must try once more; that by kindness, tenderness and persuasion there was still hope of saving her, of bringing her back to herself, and every day he was on the verge of talking to her

passages.fragment: he began to think of all these details
passages.full_quote: It made his blood run cold when <used>he began to think of all these details</used>

passages.fragment: of all these details was by no means
passages.full_quote: And Levin saw that the organization <used>of all these details was by no means</used> so easy as he had fancied before

passages.fragment: was by no means out of the wood
passages.full_quote: I retired to rest that night on a note of triumph, but I awoke to realize that I <used>was by no means out of the wood</used>
